cyclone.name: OPHELIA
cyclone.current_location: about 120 miles SE of Cape Fear, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: tracking north-northwest toward the central North Carolina coast, then forecast to sweep across eastern NC, southeastern VA, and the Delmarva Peninsula
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or just north of Surf City, NC (central NC coast)

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Surf City, NC to Ocracoke Inlet, NC (Hurricane Watch area)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Cape Fear, NC to Fenwick Island, DE including Albemarle & Pamlico Sounds, lower Chesapeake Bay, and lower Tidal Potomac
weather_observation.impacted_coast: South Santee River, SC northward through the entire North Carolina coastline and into the Mid-Atlantic states
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–57 mph) likely; brief gusts to near 60 mph possible during closest approach early Saturday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–3 ft of inundation possible along the lower Cape Fear River and adjacent beaches south of Surf City.
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–5 inches with locally up to 7 inches; flash and urban flooding possible around the port area.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents and a low-end tornado risk in outer rain bands.
